spec.name: Azure container Registry
spec.description:
The ACR plugin can be used to build and publish images to the Azure ECR
registry.

spec.name: airbrake-deployment
spec.description: Use the airbrake-deployment plugin to notify Airbrake of deployment in a certain environment.

airbrake_environment.description: environment have been deployed in the drone build

secrets.description: project ID of airbrake project & project API key of airbrake project

spec.name: Ansible
spec.description: The Ansible plugin can be used to run ansible plays.

check.description: run a check, do not apply any changes

diff.description: show the differences, may print secrets

extra_vars.description: set additional variables as key=value e.g. 'key1=value1,[key2=value2]'

flush_cache.description: clear the fact cache for every host in inventory

force_handlers.description: run handlers even if a task fails

forks.description: specify number of parallel processes to use

galaxy_force.description: force overwriting an existing role or collection

limit.description: further limit selected hosts to an additional pattern

list_hosts.description: outputs a list of matching hosts

list_tasks.description: list all tasks that would be executed

module_path.description: prepend paths to module library e.g. 'path1,[path2]'

playbook.description: list of playbooks to apply e.g. 'playbook1,[playbook2]'

private_key.description: use this key to authenticate the ssh connection

scp_extra_args.description: specify extra arguments to pass to scp only

sftp_extra_args.description: specify extra arguments to pass to sftp only

skip_tags.description: only run plays and tasks whose tags do not match

ssh_common_args.description: specify common arguments to pass to sftp/scp/ssh

ssh_extra_args.description: specify extra arguments to pass to ssh only

start_at_task.description: start the playbook at the task matching this name

syntax_check.description: perform a syntax check on the playbook

tags.description: only run plays and tasks tagged with these values

timeout.description: override the connection timeout in seconds

spec.name: Anynines
spec.description: This plugin deploys your application on the Anynines platform.

spec.name: Apex Up
spec.description: This plugin can deploy infinitely scalable serverless apps, apis, and sites in seconds to AWS using apex/up tool.

secrets.description: AWS access key and secret access key.

stage.description: Target stage names - staging or production.

spec.name: APKO
spec.description: Plugin to build OCI images from APK packages without Dockerfile. Learn more about apko at https://github.com/chainguard-dev/apko.

archs.description: The "linux" architecture for which the images will be built. Defaults "$(uname -m)". Valid values are: "amd64", "arm64".

aws_access_key_id.description: The AWS "AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID" that will be used to authenticate "image_repo". Valid only if "publish is true" and "image_repo" is a ECR repo

aws_secret_access_key.description: The AWS "AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY" that will be used to authenticate "image_repo". Valid only if "publish is true" and "image_repo" is a ECR repo

build_output_dir.description: The output directory relative to `config_file` where the build artifacts will be generated.

config_file.description: The apko configuration YAML file, a path relative to drone pipeline. https://github.com/chainguard-dev/apko/blob/main/docs/apko_file.md">

google_application_credentials.description: The base64 encoded Google application credentials i.e. SA key.json. This parameter is useful only when your "image_repo" is [Google Artifact registry](https://cloud.google.com/artifact-registry/docs). NOTE: Use GNU base64 when encoding key.json e.g using jq tool `cat "$GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS" | jq -r -c . | gbase64 --wrap=0 | pbcopy`

image_registry_password.description: The user password that will be used to push the image to `image_repo`. Applicable when the `image_repo` is not GAR, ECR.

image_registry_username.description: The user name that will be used to push the image to `image_repo`. Applicable when the `image_repo` is not GAR, ECR.

image_repo.description: The fully qualified image repository where the built OCI image will be pushed. e.g. quay.io/kameshsampath/my-app:1.0.0

publish.description: Whether to publish the image to "image_repo". Defaults to "false" which will just build the image tarball in "$PROJECT_HOME/dist" folder.

spec.name: Artifactory
spec.description: Use this plugin to publish artifacts from the build to Artifactory.

artifact_id.default: default to value from Pom file.

force_upload.description: Force upload if a file already exists.

group_id.default: default to value from Pom file.

pom.description: The path to a pom.xml file were to read project details.

repo_key.default: libs-snapshot-local if version contains snapshot, libs-release-local otherwise.

version.default: default to value from Pom file.

spec.name: Backblaze B2
spec.description: The B2 plugin uploads files and build artifacts to your B2 bucket.

path_style.description: whether path style URLs should be used (true for minio).

source.description: source location of the files, using a glob matching pattern.

strip_prefix.description: strip the prefix from source path.

target.description: target location of files in the bucket.

spec.name: Bluemix Cloud Foundry
spec.description: The Bluemix Cloud Foundry plugin can be used to deploy files and/or services to Bluemix.

no_hostname.description: Map the root domain to this app

no_route.description: Do not map a route to this app and remove routes from previous pushes of this app.

no_start.description: Do not start an app after pushing.

random_route.description: Create a random route for this app.

skip_ssl.description: Skip verification of the API endpoint. Not recommended!.

spec.name: Drone Buildah
spec.description: Drone plugin uses Buildah to build and publish Docker images to a container registry. It mimics the Docker plugin.

pull-image.description: force pull base image at build time

repo.description: docker repository used to push image

tags.description: tag used to tage built image, default "latest"

tags_suffix.description: suffix to append to build tags

spec.name: Drone Cache
spec.description: A Drone plugin for caching current workspace files between builds to reduce your build times. `drone-cache` is a small CLI program, written in Go without any external OS dependencies (such as tar, etc).

archive-format.description: archive format to use for the cache directories (tar, gzip).

backend.description: cache backend to use in plugin (s3, filesystem).

cache-key.description: cache key to use for the cache directories.

filesystem-cache-route.description: local filesystem root directory for the filesystem cache.

mount.description: cache directories, an array of folders to cache.

path-style.description: use path style for bucket paths. (true for minio, false for aws).

rebuild.description: whether to rebuild the cache directories.

restore.description: whether to restore the cache directories.

spec.name: Capistrano
spec.description: The Capistrano plugin deploys applications via the Capistrano ruby gem.

spec.name: Captains Log
spec.description: A Drone plugin that helps organize release information in Slack

enterprise_host.description: if you use Enterprise Github, this is where you would supply the custom domain.

github_owner.description: The owner of the GitHub repository

github_tag_id.description: regex to match on specific tags

slack_channel.description: when using the API, you should use slack_channel to specify which room you'd like to post to. When using SLACK_URL you should not specify the room (i.e. slack_channel) because the room is already a part of the webhook.

teams.description: a list of teams which allows you to organize the output of Captains Log into meaningful chunks.

spec.name: Chef Supermarket
spec.description: The Chef Supermarket plugin can publish cookbooks to Supermarket (internal or public).

private_key.description: private key contents to auth to server with

spec.name: CircleCI
spec.description: The CircleCI plugin allows you to trigger builds automatically.

spec.name: Clair
spec.description: The Clair plugin submits your docker image to your Clair server to scan your docker image for security vulnerabilities.

password.description: Docker Registry password to download the `scan_image` from

scan_image.description: The docker image to scan.  Supports Docker Hub or private repos.

username.description: Docker Registry username to download the `scan_image` from

spec.name: Cloudflare Caching
spec.description: Our Drone plugin enables the ability for your pipeline to interface with Cloudflare's API to purge cache.

action.description: What type of cache purge, options are purge_everything, purge_hosts, purge_files, purge_tags.

list.description: List of values, could be valid hosts, tags, or files depending on action parameter value.

spec.name: Cloudflare DNS
spec.description: Our Drone plugin enables the ability for your pipeline to interface with Cloudflare's API to create/update/delete DNS records.

action.description: What type of action, options are set, unset.

record_ttl.description: Time to live value in seconds for DNS record.

record_type.description: Type of DNS record, examples include A, CNAME, NS, etc.

spec.name: CloudFlare Pages
spec.description: The Cloudflare Pages plugin is used to publish static websites to CloudFlare Pages. The following configuration uses the wrangler cli to publish a website.

path.description: The directory of content to publish

repo_url.description: GitHub repo URL for code to publish

spec.name: AWS CloudFormation
spec.description: The CloudFormation plugin can be used to create/update or delete stacks, and to validate templates.

mode.description: Mode to run the plugin, options are createOrUpdate, create, delete, validate.

parallel.description: whether to run the batch in parallel.

params.description: object of parameters to feed into the template. Not needed for validate and delete modes.

region.description: the AWS region to deploy to.

stackname.description: the name of the CloudFormation stack. Required for all but validate mode.

template.description: the path to the CloudFormation template. Required for all but delete mode.

spec.name: Cloud Foundry
spec.description: The Cloud Foundry plugin can be used to deploy files and/or services to Cloud Foundry.

health_check_type.description: Application health check type e.g. port.

no_hostname.description: Map the route domain to this app.

no_route.description: Do not map a route to this app and remove routes from previous pushes of this app.

no_start.description: Do not start an app after pushing.

random_route.description: Generate a random route for this app.

skip_ssl.description: Skip verification of the API endpoint. Not recommended!

spec.name: Codacy
spec.description: This plugin can upload coverage reports to Codacy, currently it's limited to Golang coverage reports.

spec.name: Codecov
spec.description: This plugin allows for pushing test coverage results to Codecov.

files.description: list of target files to upload.

flags.description: flag the upload to group coverage metrics.

spec.name: Coveralls
spec.description: This plugin can upload coverage reports to Coveralls.

debug.description: if you want to debug, set it to true.

token.description: if you have not set environment COVERALLS_REPO_TOKEN, you should set the private repository token.

spec.name: Crowdin
spec.description: The Crowdin plugin allows you to submit translation files to Crowdin.

download.description: Downloads translated files from Crowdin if it is true.

export_dir.description: Export directory of the translated strings.

files.description: Map of translatable files with the Crowdin file name as key and the real filepath as value. The plugin will not upload any files if this list is empty.

ignore_branch.description: It will send the Drone branch to Crowdin if it is false.

languages.description: Languages which should be downloaded/exported from Crowdin.

spec.name: Datadog
spec.description: The plugin can be used to send events and metrics to Datadog from a drone pipeline.

dry_run.description: When set to true, the plugin only computes metrics and events without sending anything to the Datadog intake. When the plugin runs in dry mode, it doesn't require an api_key to be set, useful for testing.

events.description: A list of events to be sent to Datadog. An event must have a title and a text; alert_type defaults to info.

metrics.description: A list of metrics to be sent to Datadog. A metric must have a name and a value; type defaults to gauge; tags and hostname are optional.

spec.name: DCO
spec.description: The DCO plugin enforces the Developer Certificate of Origin.

spec.name: Deta
spec.description: The Deta plugin deploy your build to deta.sh(https://deta.sh).

access_token.description:
Deta access token. 
How to get Deta access token? https://docs.deta.sh/docs/cli/auth#deta-access-tokens

spec.name: diagnostics
spec.description: A plugin with cli network tools (dig / ping / traceroute) to diagnose issues in a build. It does not accept any properties.

spec.name: DingTalk
spec.description: The DingTalk can be used to send a message by DingTalk group robot.

message_color.description: color the title and content for easier identification.

message_pic.description: insert a picture into a message to make the content richer.

sha_link.description: sha as a link to click to the source code page.

token.description: you can get the access token when you add a bot in a group.

type.description: dingtalk message type, markdown is the best type now.

spec.name: Discord
spec.description: The discord plugin posts build status messages to discord channel.

avatar_url.description: override the default avatar of the webhook.

username.description: override the default username of the webhook.

spec.name: Docker
spec.description:
The Docker plugin can be used to build and publish images to the Docker
registry.

auto_tag.description: generate tag names automatically based on git branch and git tag

auto_tag_suffix.description: generate tag names with this suffix

build_args.description: pass custom arguments to docker build

build_args_from_env.description: pass the envvars as custom arguments to docker build

cache_from.description: images to consider as cache sources

compress.description: compress the build context using gzip

context.description: the context path to use, defaults to root of the git repo

custom_dns.description: set custom dns servers for the container

debug.description: launch the docker daemon in verbose debug mode

dry_run.description: boolean if the docker image should not be pushed at the end

insecure.description: enable insecure communication to this registry

launch_debug.description: launch the docker daemon in verbose debug mode

mirror.description: use a mirror registry instead of pulling images directly from the central Hub

no_cache.description: do not use cached intermediate containers

platform.description: specify the target platform for the build output, (for example, linux/amd64, linux/arm64, or darwin/amd64).

pull_image.description: force pull base image at build time

purge.description: boolean if cleanup of the docker image should be done at the end

secret.description: Use buildkit to pass secrets to the dockerbuild. Eg `id=mysecret,src=secret-file`

squash.description: squash the layers at build time

ssh-agent-key.description: private key to use for ssh passthrough, see https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/buildx_build/#ssh

target.description: the build target to use, must be defined in the docker file

spec.name: Doumark
spec.description: Drone plugin for Douban(https://douban.com) movie/book/music marked data sync automatically.

dir.description: Target where douban data sync to. It's a file path for csv and json format, and a notion database id for notion format.

format.description: Douban data store format, enum value: csv, json, notion

type.description: Douban data Type, enum value: movie, book, music

spec.name: Download
spec.description: Use the Download plugin to download archives required for your builds, it also integrates a secure way to inject basic authentication credentials and checking by md5 or sha256 checksums.

destination.description: The destination path for the download.

source.description: The source URL for the download.

spec.name: Downstream Build
spec.description: Use this plugin to trigger builds for a list of downstream repositories. This

deploy.description: Trigger a deployment (promote build), value is the environment/target for the new build.

last_successful.description: Trigger the last successful build for the branch specified in repositories.

params.description: supports params in KEY=value format as well as loading of params from godotenv files.

repositories.description: trigger builds for the repository list, you can mention branch using @.

timeout.description: how long to wait on any currently running builds.

wait.description: wait for any currently running builds to finish if true, else fails.

spec.name: Dron8s
spec.description: Yet another Kubernetes plugin for Drone using dynamic Server Side Apply to achieve `kubectl apply -f multi-configs.yaml` parity for your CI-CD pipelines.

kubeconfig.description: Needed for out-of-cluster use. If not present plugin will default to in-cluster configuration. You can find kubeconfig under ~/.kube/config

spec.name: AWS ECR
spec.description: The ECR plugin can be used to build and publish images to the Amazon ECR registry.

build_args.description: custom arguments passed to docker build.

create_repository.description: Create repository if it does not exist.

custom_dns.description: set custom dns servers for the container.

insecure.description: enable insecure communication to this registry.

lifecycle_policy.description: filename of ecr lifecycle json policy.

mirror.description: use a mirror registry instead of pulling images directly from the central Hub.

repository_policy.description: filename of ecr repository json policy.

scan_on_push.description: boolean of whether to enable automatic ECR images vulnerabilities scanning for repository if it was created with create_repository=true.

storage_driver.description: supports aufs, overlay or vfs drivers.

tags.description: repository tag for the image, defaults to latest.

spec.name: AWS ECS Deploy
spec.description: This plugin allows updating an ECS service. The plugin is a wrapper for ecs-deploy, this bash works by taking the current task definition of a service and just changing the image so that all the configuration stays the same.

image_name.description: Name of Docker image to run, e.g. repo/image:latest.

max.description: The upper limit on the number of running tasks during a deployment.

min.description: The lower limit on the number of running tasks during a deployment.

timeout.description: Script monitors ECS Service for new task definition to be running.

spec.name: AWS ECS
spec.description: The ECS plugin can be used to deploy a Docker image to an ECS environment.

environment_variables.description: list of environment variables to pass to ecs.

memory.description: memory to assign to the service.

port_mappings.description: list of port mappings to pass to ecs.

service.description: ecs service on that environment to upgrade.

spec.name: AWS Elastic Beanstalk
spec.description: The Elastic Beanstalk plugin can be used to deploy an app to a Beanstalk environment.

environment_update.description: Flag whether to update ElasticBeansTalk environment with the new version.

spec.name: Email
spec.description: The email plugin can be used to notify people of a build result.

attachment.description: An optional file to attach to the sent mail(s). This can be an absolute path or a path relative to the working directory.

body.description: The email body template (handlebars template). This can be an inline template, or a URL (file:/// allowed)

from.description: The email address to send the notification from.

recipients.description: List of recipients to send this mail to (besides the commit author).

recipients_file.description: File containing a list of recipients to send this mail to (besides the commit author).

recipients_only.description: Do not send mails to the commit author, but only to recipients.

spec.name: Facebook
spec.description: The Facebook plugin posts build status messages to your account.

audios.description: a valid URL to an audio message.

files.description: a valid URL to a file message.

images.description: a valid URL to an image message.

videos.description: a valid URL to a video message.

spec.name: Fandogh
spec.description: This plugin can help you to easy delivery your new docker images to fandogh PaaS.

spec.name: FTP(S)
spec.description: The FTPS plugin can be used to publish artifacts over FTP(S).

chmod.description: if set to true chmod would be executed after file transferred, otherwise no chmod.

dest_dir.description: where to put the files on the remote server.

exclude.description: egrep like pattern matching to exclude files from uploading.

include.description: egrep like pattern matching to include files for uploading.

secure.description: if set to true FTPS is enforced, otherwise plain FTP is used.

src_dir.description: which local directory should be used for the upload.

verify.description: if set to true the SSL certificate validation is enforced, otherwise no validation.

spec.name: Google Cloud Functions
spec.description: The GCF plugin can be used to deploy, list, and delete Google Cloud Functions.

action.description: can be either deploy, delete, or list.

functions.description: list of functions to be deployed, each needs to at least provide a trigger but can also set memory, runtime, and source.

project.default: the project of the service account

runtime.description: runtime of the functions to be deployed. Can be specified once or one a per function basis.

token.description: json credentials of the service account to access Google Cloud Functions.

spec.name: Google Container Registry
spec.description: The GCR plugin can be used to build and publish images to the Google Container Registry.

json_key.description: json key - can be inline or base64 encoded

workload_identity.description: flag if key is a workload identity key

spec.name: Google Cloud Storage
spec.description: The Google Cloud Storage plugin uploads files and build artifacts to your Google Cloud Storage bucket.

acl.description: access to files that are uploaded (private, public)

compress.description: gzip files before they are uploaded and add a Content-Encoding gzip

source.description: source location of the files, using a glob matching pattern

strip_prefix.description: strip the prefix from source path

target.description: target location of files in the bucket

spec.name: Google Cloud Storage Cache
spec.description: The GCS cache plugin can be used to preserve files and directories between builds.

bucket.description: bucket to use to rebuild and restore cache.

fallback_path.description: fallback path for the cache file.

flush.description: mode to flush the cache of old cache items (please be sure to set this so we don't waste storage).

flush_age.description: flush cache files older then x days.

flush_path.description: path to search for flushable cache files.

path.description: path to store the cache file.

rebuild.description: mode to rebuild the cache from the build environment and specified mounts.

restore.description: mode to restore the build environment from cache.

spec.name: Google Cloud Storage
spec.description: The GCS plugin can be used to publish files and artifacts to Google Cloud Storage.

acl.description: a list of access rules applied to the uploaded files, in a form of entity:role

gzip.description: files with the specified extensions will be gzipped and uploaded with "gzip" Content-Encoding header e.g. js,css,html

ignore.description: skip files matching this pattern, relative to source

metadata.description: an arbitrary dictionary with custom metadata applied to all objects

target.description: destination to copy files to, including bucket name

token.description: credentials to access Google Cloud Storage

spec.name: GitHub Pages
spec.description: The GitHub Pages plugin is used to publish static websites to GitHub. The following configuration uses the gh-pages plugin to publish a website.

pages_directory.description: The directory of content to publish

ssh_key.description: SSH key to use for pushing changes

temporary_base.description: Temporary directory to pull gh-pages branch

spec.name: Git Push
spec.description: Use this plugin for deploying an application via `git push`. You will need to supply Drone with a private SSH key or use the same credentials as the cloned repo to being able to push changes.

commit.description: add and commit the contents of the repo before pushing.

commit_message.description: add a custom message for commit.

empty_commit.description: create an empty commit if there are no changes.

local_branch.description: local branch or ref to push from.

remote.description: target remote repository (if blank, assume exists).

remote_name.description: name of the remote to use locally.

ssh_key.description: Private SSH key for the remote machine.

spec.name: Git
spec.description: The git plugin is used to clone a git repository. Note that Drone uses the git plugin by default for all repositories, without any configuration required.

depth.description: creates a shallow clone with truncated history.

submodule_update_remote.description: pass the --remote flag to git submodule update.

tags.description: fetches tags when set to true.

spec.name: Gitea Comment
spec.description: Use this plugin to update build status on Gitea Pull Request. This is useful when the complete team does not want to open drone dashboard for each build message.

comment.description: the content of the comment (required if comment_from_file is not used)

comment_from_file.description: the file path to read from (required if comment is not used)

gitea_base_url.description: the url of the gitea installation

spec.name: Gitea Release
spec.description: The gitea-release plugin is used to publish files and artifacts to Gitea Release.

checksum.description: checksum takes hash methods to include in your Gitea release for the files specified. Supported hash methods include - md5, sha1, sha256, sha512, adler32, and crc32.

file_exists.description: what to do if an file asset already exists, supported values - overwrite, skip and fail.

files.description: files to upload to Gitea Release, globs are allowed.

insecure.description: visit base_url via insecure https protocol

note.description: file or string with notes for the release

title.description: file or string for the title shown in the gitea release

spec.name: Gitee Pulls
spec.description: This plugin can automatically update the comments / labels / test in PR to gitee.

access_token.description: gitee access token, you can generate personal access token

comment_disabled.description: disable automatic updating of the comment with build status

failure_label.description: set the name and color of the failure label

label_disabled.description: disable automatic updating of the label with build status

running_label.description: set the name and color of the running label

success_label.description: set the name and color of the success label

test_disabled.description: disable automatic updating of the test status

spec.name: Github App
spec.description: A plugin to get a jwt or installation token for a github app.

json_file.description: output file for both jwt and token in json

pem_b64.description: local file path of base64 encoded rsa private key

pem_file.description: local file path of rsa private key

spec.name: Github-changelog-generator
spec.description: This plugin can be used to create a changelog file based on GitHub tags, it will not auto-push it into the repo but rather create a changelog file for you to upload into your desired location via other Drone plugins.

output_path.description: The changelog file path to be created in the current working directory (repo root by default)

spec.name: Github Comment
spec.description: Use this plugin to update build status on Github Pull Request. This is useful when the complete team does not want to open drone dashboard for each build message.

github_app_id.description: your app id for drone on github

github_installation_id.description: installation id of github app for drone

spec.name: Github Release
spec.description: The github-release plugin is used to publish files and artifacts to GitHub Release.

api_key.description: GitHub oauth token with public_repo or repo permission. If you create your token, ensure you select the correct scope. For private repositories you have to select repo while public repositories only requires public_repo.

base_url.description: GitHub base URL, only required for GHE

checksum.description: checksum takes hash methods to include in your GitHub release for the files specified. Supported hash methods include - md5, sha1, sha256, sha512, adler32, and crc32.

file_exists.description: what to do if an file asset already exists, supported values - overwrite, skip and fail.

files.description: files to upload to GitHub Release, globs are allowed

note.description: file or string with notes for the release

overwrite.description: force overwrite existing release informations (only title and note)

title.description: file or string for the title shown in the gitea release

upload_url.description: GitHub upload URL, only required for GHE

spec.name: Github Search Downstream
spec.description: Use this plugin to trigger builds for a list of downstream repositories fetched from a Github repository search. This is useful when updates to a repository have downstream impacts that should also be tested, and those repository are searchable on Github.

github_query.description: Query to search Github for downstream repositories

ignore_missing.description: continue triggering if build is not found

timeout.description: how long to wait on any currently running builds.

wait.description: wait for any currently running builds to finish if true, else fails

spec.name: Gitlab-CI
spec.description: The Gitlab-ci plugin allows you to trigger Gitlab-ci job automatically.

ref.description: valid refs are only the branches and tags

spec.name: Gitleaks
spec.description: A plugin to detect hard-coded secrets and sensitive data in your source code files.

config.description: The path to the gitleaks config file.

path.description: The path to the directory containing the source code files.

spec.name: Google Chat
spec.description: The Google chat plugin posts build status messages to your company google chat.

conversation_key.description: arbitrary key to group messages together.

webhook.description: incomming webhook in the Bots section of google chat.

spec.name: Google Cloud Auth
spec.description: Plugin that allows you create and configure the Google Cloud auth configuration file that could be used with gcloud CLI. The plugin also configures Docker configuration(~/.docker/config.json) to enable push and pull of the container images from Google Artifact Registry.  **IMPORTANT:** The plugin supports only Google Artifact Registry.

google_application_credentials.description: The Google Cloud Service Account JSON that will be used to configure your `gcloud` authorizations to be used with gcloud CLI.

google_cloud_project.description: The Google project which will be set as default project on when using "glcoud".

google_cloud_region.description: The Google region which will be set as default `compute/region` when using `gcloud`. You can find the available regions using the command "gcloud compute regions list". If configured this region will be enabled for Google Artifact Registry.

registry_locations.description: The list of Google Artifact Registry locations to configure with Google Cloud Docker credential helper.

spec.name: Google Cloud Run
spec.description: Plugin to build and manage Google Cloud Run services.

allow_unauthenticated.description: Allow public access to the service.

delete.description: If the service needs to be deleted.

image.description: The container image that will be used for the service.

project.description: The Google project where the Google Cloud Run service will be deployed.

region.description: The Google Cloud region e.g asia-south1 where the Google Cloud Run service will be deployed.

service_account_json.description: The Google Cloud Service Account JSON that has required permissions to create, update and delete Google Cloud Run services .

service_name.description: The name of the Google Cloud Run service.

spec.name: GPG Sign
spec.description: This plugin can sign your artifacts and build results with [GnuPG](https://www.gnupg.org/).

excludes.description: List of globs to exclude files.

files.description: List of globs to match files.

key.description: Private GnuPG key, optionally base64 encoded.

spec.name: Grafana Annotation
spec.description: The Grafana Annotation plugin can be used to create an annotation in [Grafana](https://grafana.com).

tags.description: The tags to add to the annotation

spec.name: GTalk
spec.description: The GTalk plugin posts build status messages to your google account.

spec.name: Harness Terraform
spec.description: Terraform plugin to use in the IACM module in Harness

command.description: Commands that indicates what action the plugin will perform. Current supported values are init, plan, apply or destroy

spec.name: Helm
spec.description: This plugin allows you to run Kubernetes Helm as part of your pipeline.

debug.description: very verbose output. it will display all the ENVVARS passed to the container. Very handy when debugging secrets.

namespace.description: namespace where you want to install your chart. If you don't specify this parameter

prefix.description: defines the prefix of all the secrets used in the plugin. If prefix is DEV and your secret should be named DEV_PASSWORD and the values would be ${PASSWORD}. If prefix is PROD the secret should be defined as PROD_PASSWORD. This allows you to define different secrets for different.

release.description: name used in the helm command to specify the release
release.default: If you don't specify the release, helm will generate a random name and you will not be able to upgrade that release.

skip_tls_verify.description: if you create your own SSL certificates, youi will need this flag to be true to avoid having connectivity issues.

tiller_ns.description: namespace where tiller will be installed.

values.description: values injected in helm command. These are the values you want to overwrite.

spec.name: Helm3
spec.description: This plugin provides an interface to Helm 3.

add_repos.description: Run helm repo add before running the main helm command.

chart.description: Helm chart to install or lint.

chart_version.description: Version of the chart to install.

debug.description: Produce debug output from the plugin and helm itself. Note that this option may expose secrets in the log output.

dry_run.description: Prepare the un/installation, but do not perform it.

kube_certificate.description: Base64-encoded TLS certificate, for clusters using a self-signed CA certificate.

kube_service_account.description: Account name for connecting to the kubernetes api.

mode.description: Helm command to run; valid options are upgrade, lint, and uninstall. If not provided, can be inferred from the Drone event.

repo_ca_certificate.description: Base64 encoded TLS certificate for a chart repository certificate authority.

repo_certificate.description: Base64 encoded TLS certificate for a chart repository.

reuse_values.description: Reuse the values from a previous release.

skip_tls_verify.description: Do not check for a valid certificate when connecting to the kubernetes api.

timeout.description: Timeout for any individual kubernetes operation, formatted as a Golang duration (e.g. "3m20s").

update_dependencies.description: Run helm dependency update before running the main helm command.

wait_for_upgrade.description: Wait until kubernetes resources are in a ready state before marking the installation successful.

spec.name: Heroku
spec.description: The heroku plugin can be used to build and publish images to the Heroku container registry.

spec.name: Mercurial
spec.description: The mercurial plugin is used to clone a mercurial repository.

spec.name: Hugo
spec.description: The Hugo plugin automatically generates static web page files, which can be published afterwards!

buildFuture.description: include content with publishdate in the future.

config.description: The path to the config file.

content.description: The path to the content directory.

layout.description: The path to the layout directory.

output.description: The path to the output directory.

source.description: The path to read files relative from.

spec.name: InstantAccess()
spec.description: The InstantAccess plugin posts build status messages to your account.

channel.description: The InstantAccess() channel key, get key by http://push.ijingniu.cn/push/channel/

spec.name: IRC
spec.description: The IRC plugin can be used to send notifications to an IRC channel.

spec.name: Java Maven
spec.description: The Java Apache Maven plugin that can be used to build Java applications using Apache Maven build tool.

context_dir.description: The context directory within the source repository where "pom.xml" is found to execute the maven goals. Defaults to Drone workspace root.

goals.description: An array of maven goals to run.

maven_mirror_url.description: The maven mirror to use for downloading the build dependencies.

maven_modules.description: An array of maven modules to be built incase of a multi module maven project.

proxy_password.description: The password for the proxy server.

proxy_port.description: Port number for the proxy server.

proxy_protocol.description: Protocol for the proxy ie http or https.

proxy_user.description: The username for the proxy server.

server_password.description: The password for the maven repository manager server.

server_user.description: The username for the maven repository manager server.

spec.name: Jenkins
spec.description: The Jenkins plugin allows you to trigger Jenkins job automatically.

spec.name: JFrog Artifactory
spec.description: A plugin to upload files to Jfrog artifactory.

flat.description: if true, artifacts are downloaded to the exact target path specified and their hierarchy in the source repository is ignored. if false, artifacts are downloaded to the target path in the file system while maintaining their hierarchy in the source repository

insecure.description: if true, the connection to the source repository is not validated by checking the server certificate. if false, the connection to the source repository is validated by checking the server certificate

pem_file_contents.description: pem file contents for authentication with artifactory, cannot be used in conjunction with insecure

pem_file_path.description: pem file path for authentication with artifactory, defaults to either "C:/users/ContainerAdministrator/.jfrog/security/certs/cert.pem" or "/root/.jfrog/security/certs/cert.pem"

target.description: destination of source files in artifactory

spec.name: Jira
spec.description: A plugin to attach build and deployment details to a Jira issue. It can use oauth client id / oauth secret OR use Jira connect key. For further information on how to use the plugin with harness there is a video `https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YIKbLeY1-gI`.

client_id.description: The Jira Oauth2 client ID. You must also pass the client secret.

client_secret.description: The Jira Oauth2 client secret. You must also pass the client id.

connect_key.description: The Jira Connect key. This is instead of passing oauth information.

instance.description: The Jira instance. The prefix on your atlassian hostname.

link.description: The link to the Jira deployment.

log_level.description: debug/info Level defines the plugin log level. Set this to debug to see the response from jira

spec.name: Kubernetes Plugin
spec.description: Drone CI plugin for creating & updating K8s Resources.   This plugin supports all Kubernetes resources and also supports creating/updating Configmaps from config files.

Other_parameters.description: Other parameters will be made available for interpolation within yaml templates (upper-case will be converted to lower-case).

config_files.description: Config file paths for automatic creation/update of ConfigMap.The syntax is expressed as `namespace:name:file_path:file_name` or `namespace:name:file_path`, when file_name is not specified, it will default to the file name of file_path.

debug.description: Used to enable debug level logging.

init_templates.description: Path to Kubernetes Resource yaml based definition file (e.g. ConfigMap, Deployment or others), used to initialize some resources.

kubernetes_ca_crt.description: The same as `k8s_ca_crt`. Certificate from ServiceAccount for authentication to the API server.

kubernetes_server.description: The same as `k8s_server`. The address and port of the Kubernetes API server.

kubernetes_skip_tls.description: The same as `k8s_skip_tls`. If true, the server's certificate will not be checked for validity. This will make your HTTPS connections insecure.

kubernetes_token.description: The same as `k8s_token`. Token from ServiceAccount for authentication to the API server.

namespace.description: Default namespace to use when namespace is not set.

templates.description: Path to Kubernetes Resource yaml based definition file (e.g. ConfigMap, Deployment or others).

spec.name: Kaniko ECR
spec.description: The Kaniko ECR plugin can be used to build and publish images to the Amazon ECR registry, using the Kaniko image builder. Unlike the Docker ECR plugin, you are not required you to run your agent in privileged mode.

build_args.description: custom arguments passed to docker build.

create_repository.description: Create repository if it does not exist.

lifecycle_policy.description: filename of ecr lifecycle json policy.

repository_policy.description: filename of ecr repository json policy.

tags.description: repository tags to apply to the image

target.description: the build target to use, must be defined in the docker file

spec.name: Kaniko
spec.description: This plugin can be used to build and publish images to the Docker registry, using the Kaniko image builder. Unlike the Docker plugin you are not required you to run your agent in privileged mode.

build_args.description: custom arguments passed to docker build.

tags.description: repository tags to apply to the image

target.description: the build target to use, must be defined in the docker file

spec.name: Drone Kube
spec.description: Drone kubernetes plugin.

namespace.description: The namespace to deploy the template in

server.description: The kubernetes server to deploy the template in

spec.name: Kubernetes Deployments
spec.description: The Kubernetes plugin can be used to upgrade a Kubernetes deployment with a newer version of an image.

container.description: Container name (setup with the name option in the kubernetes manifest).

repo.description: Image to update full name (with registry path).

spec.name: Kubevious
spec.description: The Kubevious plugin detects and prevents errors(typos, misconfigurations, conflicts, inconsistencies) and violations of best practices for Kubernetes applications and clusters.

crds.description: Path to CRDs to include in validation

helm_include_crds.description: Indicates whether or not to include CRDs in Helm release

helm_repo_name.description: Name alias for Helm repository URL

k8s_version.description: Version of Kubernetes to validate againts

manifests.description: Path to manifest files, directories or URLs to validate

mocks.description: Path to mocked manifests to include in validation

only_rule_categories.description: Run only specified rules by category

spec.name: AWS Lambda
spec.description: The plugin automatically deployes a serverless function to AWS Lambda from a zip file located in an S3 bucket. This plugin does not handle creating or uploading the zip file.

aws_default_region.description: AWS region. This variable overrides the default region of the in-use profile, if set.

aws_secret_access_key.description: AWS secret key. Access and secret key variables override credentials stored in config files.

file_name.description: Name of the file in S3. Can be prefixed like my-directory/my-zip-package.zip.

function_name.description: Name of the lambda function as set in AWS.

s3_bucket.description: Name of the S3 bucket in which the zip package for deployment is stored.

spec.name: Line
spec.description: The Line plugin posts build status messages to your channel.

to.description: The user ID to send a message to

spec.name: Load and store
spec.description: This plugin can be used to load and publish images to the Docker registry. It can come in handy when the default Docker plugin cannot be used. A good example usecase is building Docker images with nix which produces a Docker image archive.

archive.description: location of the docker image archive.

password.description: The password to use for the repository

username.description: The username to use for the repository

spec.name: Manifest
spec.description: This plugin can push manifests for multi-arch Docker images.

auto_tag.description: Auto tags, only used with spec.

default_tags.description: Default tags, only used with spec.

platforms.description: List of platforms in format OS/ARCH.

spec.description: Path to a manifest specification file.

template.description: Template for manifest sources, OS and ARCH are replaced.

spec.name: Marathon
spec.description: This plugin can be used to deploy applications to a Marathon server.

trigger_restart.description: Force a restart of the application.

values.description: Map of values to replace in the marathonfile.

spec.name: Matrix
spec.description: This plugin can be used to send build success or failure messages to a Matrix room.

roomid.description: Room ID to send messages (not alias, but ID, and you can skip the !).

spec.name: Matrixchat Notifications
spec.description: A plugin to send notifications to Matrix chat rooms from CI pipeline steps. Supports Jinja message templates and Markdown rendering.

accesstoken.description:
Access token to use for authentication instead of `password`.

Either an access token or a password is required.

allowed_attrs.description: List or string with comma-separated list of HTML attribute names or dict mapping tag names to lists of attributes names.

allowed_tags.description:
List or set or string with comma-separated list of HTML tag names.

HTML tags not included will be stripped from the HTML output generated by
rendering a Markdown message template.

deviceid.description: Device ID to send with access token.

devicename.description: Device name to send with access token.

jinja.description: If set to true, `yes`, `y`, `true`, `t`, `on` or `1`, the message template is rendered with the Jinja templating engine.

markdown.description: If set to true, `yes`, `y`, `true`, `t`, `on` or `1`, the message resulting from template substtution is considered to be in Markdown format and will be rendered to HTML.

markdown_extensions.description: Comma-separated list of enabled Markdown extensions.

pass_environment.description:
Comma-separated white-list of environment variable names or name
shell-glob patterns.

Only environment variables matching any of the given names or patterns
will be available as valid placeholders in the message template.

password.description:
Password to use for authenticating the user set with `userid`.

Either a password or an access token is required.

roomid.description: ID of matrix chat room to send messages to (ID, not alias).

template.description:
The message template.

Valid placeholders (example: `${DRONE_REPO}`) will be substituted with the
values of the matching environment variables (subject to filtering
according to the `pass_environment` setting).

userid.description: Matrix user ID to send message as (ID, not username).

spec.name: Melange
spec.description: Plugin to build apk from source code. Learn more about melange at https://github.com/chainguard-dev/melange.

config_file.description: The melange configuration YAML file, a path relative to drone pipeline. https://github.com/chainguard-dev/melange/blob/main/docs/BUILD-PROCESS.md#melangeyaml

env_file.description: The environment file that will be preloaded and made available to build environment

output_dir.description: The directory where the built packages will be saved

signing_key.description: The signing key that will be used to sign the package. If not provided it will be generated and set to `melange.rsa`

spec.name: Metronome
spec.description: This plugin can be used to deploy applications to a Metronome server, it will create\update the given Metronome tasks as needed.

metronome_host.description: The Metronome server URL (no trailing slash should be used).

metronome_job_file.description: The Metronome configuration file location relative to the root folder of the repo.

spec.name: Maven Auth
spec.description: The Maven Auth plugin can be used for generating the settings.xml with server authentication for a Maven repository. Please note that dependencies are saved in the .m2 directory.

spec.name: Netlify
spec.description: The netlify plugin deploy your build to netlify.

path.description: Path to a folder or zip file to deploy.

site_id.description: Set the Site ID (or API ID in your Site settings dashboard).

spec.name: Newrelic Deployment
spec.description: The Newrelic deployment plugin reports/logs your deployment to your dashboard to make it easy to track changes.

spec.name: Nomad
spec.description: Use the Nomad plugin to deploy services from a template. You will need to supply Drone with the nomad template file.

spec.name: Now
spec.description: The Now plugin deploy your build to now.sh.

rules_file.description: File that contain set of rules

spec.name: NPM Auth
spec.description: This plugin is used to generate an .npmrc file locally to authenticate against any public/private NPM repository.

path.description: Output path of the generated .npmrc file.

spec.name: NPM
spec.description: The NPM plugin can be used to publish libraries to public or private registries.

email.description: the email for the account to publish with

folder.description: the folder, relative to the workspace, containing the library.

password.description: the password for the account to publish with

token.description: the token for the account to publish with

username.description: the username for the account to publish with

spec.name: Ntfy
spec.description: The Ntfy.sh plugin posts build status messages to your selected Ntfy server.

priority.description: Priority of the notification. Values can be [min, low, default, high, max]

token.description: Token to publish/subscribe, instead to use username/password

url.description: Ntfy server. If empty, default one will be https://ntfy.sh

spec.name: OpenFaaS
spec.description: This plugin can be used to build (generate Dockerfile and stuff) and Deploy functions to the OpenFaaS Gateway, and for the Docker image build & publish step, you can use the plugin for Kaniko or you favorite plugin.

deploy.description: set to true if you want to deploy the function.

image_name.default: reads the parameter from yaml file

password.description: the password to authenticate to the OpenFaaS Gateway.

registry.description: the registry where the Docker image is published.

tag.description: repository tag strategy for the function, based on OpenFaaS TAG.

template.description: If you need to pull a OpenFaaS store template to build the function.

tls_no_verify.description: set to true if you setup don't have a valid tls certificate.

url.description: authenticates and deploys to this OpenFaaS Gateway.

username.description: the username to authenticate to the OpenFaaS Gateway.

yaml.description: OpenFaaS function definition to be used. Optional.

spec.name: Packer
spec.description: This plugin can build automated machine images with Packer.

actions.description: a list of actions to have packer perform.

except.description: validate or build all builds other than these.

force.description: Force a build to continue if artifacts exist, deletes existing artifacts.

only.description: validate or build only the specified builds.

syntax_only.description: Only check syntax. Do not verify config of the template.

template.description: A json file will execute multiple builds in parallel as defined in the template.

var_files.description: a list of var files to use. Each value is passed as -var-file=.

vars.description: a map of variables to pass to the Packer build commands. Each value is passed as a <key>=<value> option.

spec.name: fossa
spec.description: By default, this plugin will run the analyze command per the generic CI documentation for FOSSA.

spec.name: Kubernetes
spec.description: Updates Kubernetes deployments from templates & configMaps from files. This plugin will either create or update existing resources dependent on their presence. It will wait for deployments before it progresses.

Other_parameters.description: Other parameters will be made available for interpolation within yaml templates (upper-case will be converted to lower-case).

ca.description: Base-64 encoded string of the K8s CA cert.

configmap_file.description: path to file containing data to inject in configmap (They configmap key that contains the data will be the filename).

kubernetes_token.description: Kubernetes service account token (Not base64 encoded).

server.description: Full url of Kubernetes API endpoint including protocol & port.

template.description: Path to Kubernetes yaml based definition file (Configmap or Deployment).

spec.name: PyPI
spec.description: This plugin allows you to publish Python pypi packages as part of your pipeline.

distributions.description: List of distribution types to publish.

password.description: Password to be used for the pypi publish.

repository.description: The URL of the repository to be published to.

setupfile.description: The relative path from the workspace root to the setup.py file to be used.

skip_build.description: Skip the build and only upload pre-build files from dist/*.

username.description: Username to be used for the pypi publish.

spec.name: Qodana JVM Community
spec.description: This plugin allows you to run the Qodana JVM Community linter in Drone and publish the results to Qodana Cloud. The Community license is enough.

args.description: Arguments passed to Qodana command. For example --baseline or --failure-threshold

qodana_token.description: Qodana token used to publish analysis results to Qodana cloud.

spec.name: Rancher Stack v1
spec.description: A drone.io Rancher Stack plugin to deploy/update an entire Rancher stack (not just a single service) to Rancher v1.6. See Docker Hub for more information.

accesskey.description: The access key for your rancher environment.

pull.description: Makes sure you get the latest plugin version.

secretkey.description: The secret key for your rancher environment.

stack.description: This stack must already exist in your rancher environment. E.g app-staging.

url.description: The url where your rancher resides. E.g rancher.domain.com

spec.name: Rancher
spec.description: The Rancher plugin can be used to deploy a Docker image to a Rancher environment.

access_key.description: the access key for the rancher environment

batch_size.description: number of containers to upgrade in one batch

confirm.description: auto confirm the service upgrade if successful.

docker_image.description: docker image to use to upgrade the environment

interval_millis.description: interval in milliseconds between upgrades of the containers

secret_key.description: the secret key for the rancher environment

service.description: rancher service on that environment to upgrade

start_first.description: start new container before stopping old one.

timeout.description: the maximum wait time in seconds for the service to upgrade.

url.description: the url of the rancher server

spec.name: AWS RDS Snapper
spec.description: The rds-snapper plugin cleans up specific RDS instance's snapshots, keeps specified number of copies and creates new snapshots.

spec.name: Rocket.Chat
spec.description: Drone plugin for sending message to Rocket.Chant channel using API.

avatar_url.description: override the default avatar of the user

spec.name: rsync
spec.description: The rsync plugin can be used to transfer files to remote machines, and run a user-defined script afterwards.

args.description: instruct plugin to use these additional rsync CLI arguments, e.g. "--blocking-io"

delete.description: instruct plugin to delete the target folder before copying

key.description: private SSH key for the remote machines

port.description: port to connect to on the remote machines

prescript.description: list of commands to execute on remote machines before rsync occurs

script.description: list of commands to execute on remote machines over SSH after rsync occurs

target.description: target folder on remote machines to copy to

user.description: user to connect as on the remote machines

spec.name: AWS S3 Cache
spec.description: The S3 cache plugin can be used to preserve files and directories between builds.

endpoint.description: custom endpoint URL (optional, to use a S3 compatible non-Amazon service)

fallback_path.description: fallback path for the cache file

flush.description: mode to flush the cache of old cache items (please be sure to set this so we don't waste storage)

flush_age.description: flush cache files older then x days

flush_path.description: path to search for flushable cache files.

path.description: path to store the cache file

rebuild.description: mode to rebuild the cache from the build environment and specified mounts

restore.description: mode to restore the build environment from cache

root.description: root path prefix for all cache default paths (path, fallback_path, and flush_path).

workdir.description: path where to restore the cache files to.

spec.name: AWS S3 Sync
spec.description: The S3 sync synchronizes files and build artifacts to your S3 bucket.

spec.name: AWS S3
spec.description: The S3 plugin uploads files and build artifacts to your S3 bucket, or S3-compatible bucket such as Minio.

endpoint.description: custom endpoint URL (optional, to use a S3 compatible non-Amazon service)

path_style.description: whether path style URLs should be used (true for minio)

source.description: source location of the files, using a glob matching pattern. Location must be within the drone workspace.

strip_prefix.description: strip the prefix from source path

target.description: target location of files in the bucket.

spec.name: SCP
spec.description: The SCP plugin copy files and artifacts to target host machine via SSH.

passphrase.description: Target host machine private key passphrase.

strip_components.description: Strip components from the target path.

spec.name: ServerChan(Server)
spec.description: The ServerChan plugin posts build status messages to your account.

spec.name: SFTP Cache
spec.description: Use this plugin for caching build artifacts to speed up your build times. This plugin can create and restore caches of any folders.

ignore_branch.description: flag to ignore commit branch name on hash value

key.description: plain text of user private key

spec.name: Slack Blame
spec.description: Use the Slack Blame plugin to send a message to a Slack channel or through direct message when a build completes. You will need to supply Drone with an access token to the Slack API. You can create a new access token at [https://api.slack.com/web](https://api.slack.com/web).

failure_image_attachments.description: List of image attachments for failed builds.

mapping.description: Mapping of authors to Slack users. Supports environment variable interpolation, e.g. {"$DRONE_COMMIT_AUTHOR": "$SLACK_USER"}.

success_image_attachments.description: List of image attachments for successful builds.

spec.name: Slack
spec.description: The Slack plugin posts build status messages to your channel.

channel.description: messages sent to the above webhook are posted here

icon_emoji.description: displays a emoji to the left of the username

icon_url.description: a valid URL that displays a image to the left of the username

image_url.description: a valid URL to an image file that will be displayed inside a message attachment

link_names.description: links usernames and channels in the message

recipient.description: alternatively you can send it to a specific user

username.description: choose the username this integration will post as

webhook.description: incoming webhook url for posting to a channel

spec.name: Snyk
spec.description: A plugin to scan container images for vulnerabilities using Snyk.

dockerfile.description: Path to the Dockerfile to use.

fail_on_issues.description: Fail build if issues are found.

image.description: Name of the image to scan.

spec.name: SonarScanner
spec.description: This plugin enable code analysis with different versions of NodeJS (via nvm) and  post the analysis report to your SonarQube server.  SonarQube is an open source code quality management platform.

sonar_debug.description: Enable debug flag for additional information logging

sonar_login.description: This is the login of a SonarQube user with either Execute Analysis permission on the project or Global Execute Analysis permission. Using authentication token is encouraged for security reasons. Refer to https://docs.sonarqube.org/latest/user-guide/user-token/

sonar_loglevel.description: Control the quantity / level of logs produced during an analysis.

sonar_password.description: This is the password that goes with your sonar_login username. Using authentication token is encouraged for security reasons. Refer to https://docs.sonarqube.org/latest/user-guide/user-token/

sonar_project_settings.description: Specify the path to the project configuration file.

sonar_token.description: The authentication token with either Execute Analysis permission on the project or Global Execute Analysis permission. sonar_login and sonar_password are ignored, when authentication token is provided.

use_node_version.description: Specify the node version to use for sonar-scanner, the most recent node LTS version will be selected if this variable is not specified. Example Values: 16, 16.18.1, v16, v16.18.1

spec.name: SonarQube
spec.description: This plugin can scan your code quality and post the analysis report to your SonarQube server. SonarQube (previously called Sonar), is an open source code quality management platform.

spec.name: SSH
spec.description: Use the SSH plugin to execute commands on a remote server.

command_timeout.description: Command timeout is the maximum amount of time for the execute commands

envs.description: custom secrets which are made available in the script section.

host.description: Hostname or IP address of the server.

key.description: plain text of user private key

key_path.description: Path to the private key to login to the server.

password.description: Password to login to the server.

proxy_key.description: lain text of proxy private key.

proxy_key_path.description: Path to the private key to login to the proxy.

script.description: Command to execute on the server.

timeout.description: Timeout is the maximum amount of time for the ssh connection to establish.

spec.name: Telegram
spec.description: The Telegram plugin posts build status messages to your account.

to.description: telegram user id (can be requested from the @userinfobot inside Telegram)

token.description: telegram token from telegram developer center

spec.name: Terraform
spec.description: The Terraform plugin applies the infrastructure configuration contained within the repository.

ca_cert.description: ca cert to add to your environment to allow terraform to use internal/private resources

parallelism.description: The number of concurrent operations as Terraform walks its graph.

plan.description: Whether to run a plan before applying the configuration.

remote.description: contains the configuration for the Terraform remote state tracking.

role_arn_to_assume.description: A role to assume before running the terraform commands.

root_dir.description: The root directory where the terraform files live. When unset, the top level directory will be assumed.

secrets.description: variables to pass to the Terraform `plan` and `apply` commands. Each value is passed as a `-var <key>=<ENVVAR>` option.  The `ENVVAR` is read as the key/pair value.

sensitive.description: Whether or not to suppress terraform commands to stdout.

vars.description: The backend to use for the remote.

spec.name: UPX
spec.description: The UPX plugin can be used to pack executables.

level.description: Compression level, a value between 1 and 9, the bigger the better.

original_file.description: The path to the file to save the original file.

save_file.description: The path to the file to save the upx file.

spec.name: Vercel Deploy
spec.description: Plugin that allows you deploy a site to Vercel.

log_level.description: Log level that will be used while debugging the plugin

vercel_env.description: The vercel environment to deploy. It could be one of development, preview or production.

vercel_environment_variable_file.description: An environment variable file, with each line being a KEY=VALUE pairs.

vercel_environment_variables.description: An array of KEY=VALUE pair of environment variables will be added to site project at vercel_environment scope.

vercel_org_id.description: The Vercel organization to which the site project is associated.

vercel_project_create.description: Flag to indicate if the project need to be created

vercel_project_id.description: The Vercel Project where the site will be deployed. It could be name or id of existing project or the project that will be created.

spec.name: Volume Cache
spec.description: The volume cache plugin can be used to preserve files and directories between builds.

mount.description: list of folders or files to cache

spec.name: WebDAV
spec.description: The WebDAV plugin will allow pushing build artifacts to any WebDAV server, including Nextcloud or ownCloud.

file.description: The path to the file to upload.

spec.name: Webhook
spec.description: Use the Webhook plugin to notify services via Webhook when a build completes. You will need to supply Drone with outgoing Webhook URLs.

content_type.description: The content type of the webhook.

method.description: The HTTP method to use for the request.

password.description: The password to use for basic auth.

urls.description: The URLs to send the webhook to.

username.description: The username to use for basic auth.

spec.name: Wechat for Work
spec.description: Drone plugin for WeChat for Work to show build notifications.

agent_id.description: The agent id to send the message

btntxt.description: The text for the button on the card

msg_url.description: The link for the text card click

to_party.description: The party id to send the message

to_tag.description: The tag id to send the message

to_user.description: The user id to send the message

spec.name: Wechat
spec.description: The Wechat plugin posts build status messages to your account.

agent_id.description: The agent id to send the message

btn_text.description: The text for the button on the card

msg_url.description: The link for the text card click

to_party.description: The party id to send the message

to_tag.description: The tag id to send the message

to_user.description: The user id to send the message
